title: Patcher issues...
body:
So basically for the past month I've been having this problem on and off. The problem is that the patcher is stuck at calculating differences | 1 file scanned 0%, and then after a few minutes i get an unspecified error. This has happened to me consistently for the past month on two completely different isp's, and has not allowed me to play for a majority of the time. It used to randomly fix itself, but it hasn't let up this time.

I have tried every solution in the patcher issues thread, and every other solution i could find on the internet, including but not limited to:

- Manually uninstalling my antivirus
- Disabling my firewall (also tried adding exceptions)
- Port forwarding
- Reinstalling/repairing the client (i currently have League uninstalled, and the second i try to reinstall it i get the same issue)
- The s_OK file fix (to no avail)
- Deleting various files/folders (again, nothing happens)
- Installing league of legends on a different HDD
- Closing all programs (Skype, spotify, discord, chrome, EVERYTHING besides the patcher)
- Switching regions and then switching back to NA
- Using a public dns/ flushing my dns
- Running as admin/ running using various compatibility modes.
- Running the hextech repair tool
- Installing windows updates/reinstalling net framework

I have even contacted riot support, only to wait 2 weeks for a half assed automatic response telling me to do EXACTLY what i told them i already did.

I'd like to believe this is an ISP issue (that's what everything is pointing to), but i find it hard to believe this happened consistently on two entirely different isp's.

All i want to do is be able to play the game again. I've included some pictures here, even though i'm certain everybody has seen this before:

https://gyazo.com/9162fbdd1414a2e735d218ab0534b2d9
https://gyazo.com/857cef73ff95d26d54cd7ebbdc9c1015

Any advice is appreciated, though i'm not sure what else there is to try besides a clean wipe of my entire system.

replies.body:
Since you've already submitted a ticket about this, I strongly encourage you to follow up on that ticket and continue to work with your support specialist. Since they'll have direct access to system logs, they'll have a much higher chance of pinpointing the cause of this issue.

Let me know if you have any questions.
